DataElement.preferredDefinition: The class of cells identifiable based on their structure and arrangement within an area or portion of a biological sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue, usually for further analysis or study._An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue, usually for further analysis or study.

Property.preferredDefinition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk LabCas AI, released as part of quarterly draft content review. --- The process of cutting apart or separating tissue, usually for further analysis or study.  10/15/19 jk upd OC to reflect implied "tissue dissection" in question post SME review. 10/1/19 jk created for MCL LabCas PCA-Genomic pilot.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate with a mixed population of cells in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate with a mixed population of cells in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One or more layers of EPITHELIAL CELLS, supported by the basal lamina, which covers the inner or outer surfaces of the body.

Concepts.definition: The avascular cellular layers that cover body surfaces and cavities and may form glands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

Concepts.definition: The non-neoplastic connective tissue of an organ.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
